1.brief: not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, deferred, i.e. the morrow; usually (adverbially) tomorrow; indefinitely, hereafter
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to bear young; causatively, to beget; medically, to act as midwife; specifically, to show lineage
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

2.brief: to be clear (orig. of sound, but usually of color); to shine; hence, to make ashow, to boast; and thus to be (clamorously) foolish; to rave; causatively, to celebrate; also to stultify
to turn aside (especially for lodging); hence to be aforeigner, strange, profane; specifically (active participle) to commit adultery
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
the mouth (as the means of blowing), whether literal or figurative (particularly speech); specifically edge, portion or side; adverbially (with preposition) according to
strange, in a variety of degrees and applications (foreign, non-relative, adulterous, different, wonderful)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
the lip (as a natural boundary); by implication, language; by analogy, a margin (of a vessel, water, cloth, etc.)

3.brief: heavy; figuratively in a good sense (numerous) or in a bad sense (severe, difficult, stupid)

4.brief: heat; figuratively, anger, poison (from its fever)
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
who? (occasionally, by a peculiar idiom, of things); also (indefinitely) whoever; often used in oblique construction with prefix or suffix
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

5.brief: good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
chastisement; figuratively (by words) correction, refutation, proof (even in defence)
to denude (especially in a disgraceful sense); by implication, to exile (captives being usually stripped); figuratively, to reveal
{affection (in a good or a bad sense)}
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively

6.brief: properly, to build up or support; to foster as a parent or nurse; figuratively to render (or be) firm or faithful, to trust or believe, to be permanent or quiet; morally to be true or certain;
to have affection for (sexually or otherwise)

7.brief: properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
satiated (in a pleasant or disagreeable sense)
a dripping i.e. of honey (from the comb)
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
bitter (literally or figuratively); also (as noun) bitterness, or (adverbially) bitterly

8.brief: properly, to wave to and fro (rarely to flap up and down); figuratively, to rove, flee, or (causatively) to drive away
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
a nest (as fixed), sometimes including the nestlings; figuratively, a chamber or dwelling
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
a man as an individual or a male person; often used as an adjunct to a more definite term (and in such cases frequently not expressed in translation)
properly, to wave to and fro (rarely to flap up and down); figuratively, to rove, flee, or (causatively) to drive away
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)

probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
advice; by implication, plan; also prudence
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)

not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to loosen, i.e. relinquish, permit, etc.

a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))

to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)

a resident; by extension, a fellow-citizen
a brother (used in the widest sense of literal relationship and metaphorical affinity or resemblance (like father))
remote, literally or figuratively, of place or time; specifically, precious; often used adverbially (with preposition)

a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything

to pull off, i.e. (by implication) to expose (as by stripping); specifically, to betroth (as if a surrender); figuratively, to carp at, i.e. defame; to spend the winter
a word; by implication, a matter (as spoken of) or thing; adverbially, a cause

bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
properly, to urge; by implication, to inflict apenalty, specifically, to fine

a covering, i.e. clothing; also treachery or pillage

in up to or over against; generally at, beside, among, behind, for, etc.

to wind tightly (as a rope), i.e. to bind; specifically, by a pledge; figuratively, to pervert, destroy; also to writhe in pain (especially of parturition)

great (in any sense); hence, older; also insolent
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
literally, to load up (on the back of man or beast), i.e. to start early in the morning

a day (as the warm hours), whether literal (from sunrise to sunset, or from one sunset to the next), or figurative (a space of time defined by an associated term), (often used adverb)
properly, to level, i.e. equalize; figuratively, to resemble; by implication, to adjust (i.e. counterbalance, be suitable, compose, place, yield, etc.)
